greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(-q) * phi(q^2) in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
a(n) is nonzero if and only if n is in A002479.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q)^2 * eta(q^4)^5 / (eta(q^2)^3 * eta(q^8)^2) in powers of q.
a(n) = -2 * b(n) where b(n) is multiplicative with b(2^e) = -1 if e>0, b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if p == 5, 7 (mod 8), b(p^e) = e + 1 if p == 1, 3 (mod 8).
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, Boole[n == 0], (-1)^n 2 DivisorSum[ n, KroneckerSymbol[ -2, #] &]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Oct 30 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q^2], {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Aug 29 2014 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, (-1)^n * 2 * sumdiv(n, d, kronecker( -2, d)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if ( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A)^5 / (eta(x^2 + A)^3 * eta(x^8 + A)^2), n))};
(MAGMA) A := Basis( ModularForms( Gamma1(16), 1), 80); A[1] -2*A[2] +2*A[3] - 4*A[4] + 2*A[5] + 4*A[7]; /* _Michael Somos_, Aug 29 2014 */
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 20 2007
